text: Hey, I tried asking this question last week and figured I would try it again as I did not get an answer. Basically trying to figure out how to present checkboxes using Interact.jl with some of the checkboxes already checked prior to user interaction: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/how-to-pre-check-checkboxes-using-interact-jl/53802>

attachments.title: How to Pre-check Checkboxes Using Interact.jl?
attachments.text: How do I use Interact.jl to present a list of checkboxes with some of the boxes already checked off? Tried following the documentation and couldnâ€™t figure out how to set specific checkboxes to true (i.e. checked off). What I have currently, is this: The boxes are empty by default. What I would like to have happen is for a few boxes to already be checked off when they are first shown like this: The code I have been using is: using Interact options = Observable(["a", "b", "c"]) wdg = check...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: How to Pre-check Checkboxes Using Interact.jl?

text:
Hey <@U012FH66MFW> if you are curious, here is the answer to how to do this:

```options = ["a", "b", "c"]
value = ["a", "c"]
checkboxes(options, value = value)```
<@U6BJ9E351> helped me. Would not have been able to guess this! I am hoping to make a docs PR at some point to make this more clear. :books:

elements.text: Hey
if you are curious, here is the answer to how to do this:

options = ["a", "b", "c"]
value = ["a", "c"]
checkboxes(options, value = value)
helped me. Would not have been able to guess this! I am hoping to make a docs PR at some point to make this more clear.
